meanings.definition: To groom oneself, especially by smoothing and cleaning feathers or fur.
meanings.sent1: The bird would preen its feathers after bathing in the pond.
meanings.sent2: She likes to preen her cat's fur to keep it clean and shiny.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to preen itself in front of the mirror, admiring its fluffy tail.
meanings.sent4: Watching the swan preen its feathers was like witnessing a delicate dance of beauty.
meanings.sent5: The peacock would preen its colorful plumage before strutting around the garden.

meanings.definition: To pride oneself on one's appearance or achievements.
meanings.sent1: He would preen with satisfaction after receiving compliments on his artwork.
meanings.sent2: She tends to preen when praised for her excellent grades in school.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to preen when its owner called it the 'cutest pet in the neighborhood'.
meanings.sent4: The actor couldn't help but preen when the audience applauded his performance.
meanings.sent5: The student would preen with pride as she received her award for academic excellence.

meanings.definition: To make oneself look attractive or tidy.
meanings.sent1: She would preen in front of the mirror before going out on a date.
meanings.sent2: The dog would preen itself by licking its paws and smoothing its fur.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to preen before the family photo, fixing his hair and adjusting his shirt.
meanings.sent4: The flower seemed to preen in the sunlight, showing off its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The model would preen backstage before stepping onto the runway, ensuring every hair was in place.
